stream_context.summary: Kaze iterates on the pyramid-maze subsection of the cardboard course (Course 14). After finishing a first-pass layout he now scraps it in favor of a two-story central hub with multiple exits, instant warps, and cleaner camera behavior, while beginning texture work.

development_findings.summary: Fixed the BNJ crash left over from the previous stream.
development_findings.quote: I fixed the BNJ crash from yesterday a few days ago.

development_findings.summary: First pyramid layout is being abandoned; Kaze will keep the geometry as an "unused early concept" and redesign the space around a central two-story room with 4+ exits and instant warps.
development_findings.quote: Sucks I did all this but most of this is reusable, so it's fine.

development_findings.summary: Primary design goal is to let players collect eight red coins without re-climbing the whole pyramid; solution is 3–4 instant warps that return the player to the top or the hub.
development_findings.quote: I want the player to easily be able to get back up here and not have to go the entire way up the pyramid again.

development_findings.summary: Red-coin economy decided: one coin per single corridor and two per double-corridor, totalling eight coins.
Camera is the biggest risk; tight spaces will be widened or stair heights reduced and proper camera collision flags added.
development_findings.quote: The only issue I have with here is that the camera a lot of the time is poopy.

development_findings.summary: Uses Blender + Fast64 and his own engine "Kanki"; plans to cull corridors with F3D display-list macros for performance.
Added vertex colours to Mario and a shoe shine using cycle-1 additive blending—"100 % free of cost" on performance.
development_findings.quote: Look at his shoes, I added a shine to him… and it's 100 % free of cost.

development_findings.summary: Overall schedule: hopes to finish all main content in 2025, with a separate beta / bug-fixing phase afterwards.
development_findings.quote: 2025, we're probably going to finish all the main content… but there's still beta left.

development_findings.summary: Release strategy must anticipate a Nintendo takedown; expects roughly a week of availability and may pair the ROM with a copyright-free trailer.
development_findings.quote: Last time I made a big hack I uploaded it with a copyright-free trailer… maybe I do that again.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prizes efficiency: dislikes hand-washing dishes, views time as money, and admits he is "weird with money"—still lives like he earns $7 k a year.
context_findings.quote: Washing dishes by hand is like so wasteful… I never buy anything.

context_findings.summary: Domestic anecdote: pitcher broke because Zeina kept dirty dishes in the sink; they debate whose fault it is.
context_findings.quote: We’re not a hundred percent in agreement over whose fault it is quite yet.

context_findings.summary: Emotional tone ranges from excitement ("walking up this is so fun") to frustration with constant player suggestions for Course 1.
context_findings.quote: Please, we've done enough. I think the level is great now.

biobak.summary: Confirms he will clean up current "poofy" textures and suggests cutting the cranes from the scene.
biobak.quote: I know it looks poofy right now but Biobak said he's gonna move it so I'm not worrying about it.

biobak.summary: Offers design feedback that supports the central-hub redesign; actively brainstorms with Kaze.

zeina.summary: Currently on weekend trip with the baby; serves as primary caregiver and occasionally influences Kaze’s work environment (e.g., dish dispute).

key_stories.title: Pyramid Maze Redesign
key_stories.summary: Kaze realizes the initial maze is confusing, camera-unfriendly, and forces replay if coins are missed. After chat and Biobak feedback he pivots to a hub-and-spoke layout with instant warps.
key_stories.challenge: Players would likely finish the maze without all eight red coins and face tedious backtracking.
key_stories.process: Mapped out alternate connections in Paint, defined warp logic, and declared the old build an "unused early concept."
key_stories.outcome: New blueprint with two-story central room, 6 corridors, and 3–4 instant warps; red-coin placement logic established.
key_stories.key_quote: One central room with two stories and four exits… yeah, I like that idea.

key_stories.title: The Dishwasher Debate
key_stories.summary: A household mishap (broken water pitcher) sparks a debate between Kaze and Zeina about dish-washing efficiency, revealing Kaze’s time-over-money philosophy and playful marital dynamic.
key_stories.challenge: Pitcher breaks after being set on a sink full of dishes.
key_stories.process: Kaze recounts the story on stream, polling chat about who is at fault and expanding into his disdain for manual dishwashing.
key_stories.outcome: Humorous but telling insight into personal life; reinforces Kaze’s focus on efficiency.
key_stories.key_quote: Washing dishes by hand is so wasteful—it wastes time, it wastes water, it wastes my will to live.
